title: MicroservicesObservabilityHealthCheckAPI - Q0001
text: What is the primary purpose of a health check API in microservices?

options.text: To report the operational status of a service

explanation: A health check API reports whether a service is operational and ready to handle requests.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityHealthCheckAPI - Q0002
text: Which HTTP status code typically indicates a healthy service?
explanation: A 200 OK response indicates that the service is healthy and functioning properly.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityHealthCheckAPI - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a common endpoint name for a health check API?
explanation: Common health check endpoints include /health, /status, and /ping depending on conventions.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityHealthCheckAPI - Q0004
text: What is the purpose of a liveness probe?

options.text: To check if the service process is running
To check if the service is ready to accept traffic

explanation: A liveness probe checks if the service process is alive and running.

title: MicroservicesObservabilityHealthCheckAPI - Q0005
text: What is the purpose of a readiness probe?

options.text: To check if the service is ready to handle requests
To check if the service process is running

explanation: A readiness probe determines if the service is ready to handle incoming traffic.

explanation: Health check APIs enable automated monitoring and recovery by reporting service health.
